text: Here comes the sun, doo-doo-doo-doo. Here comes the sun, and I say it's all right.
source: The Beatles - Here Comes the Sun

text: Don't stop believing, hold on to that feeling. Streetlight people, don't stop believing.
Sweet dreams are made of this. Who am I to disagree? Travel the world and the seven seas.
I'm walking on sunshine, whoa-oh! And don't it feel good? Hey, alright now.
source: Katrina and the Waves - Walking on Sunshine

text: We're no strangers to love. You know the rules and so do I. A full commitment's what I'm thinking of.
source: Rick Astley - Never Gonna Give You Up

text: Sweet Caroline, good times never seemed so good. I've been inclined to believe they never would.
I'm a believer, I couldn't leave her if I tried. I thought love was only true in fairy tales.
Don't you want me, baby? Don't you want me, oh-oh-oh? Don't you want me, baby? Don't you want me, oh-oh-oh?
source: The Human League - Don't You Want Me

text: I'm still standing better than I ever did. Looking like a true survivor, feeling like a little kid.
Sweet home Alabama, where the skies are so blue. Sweet home Alabama, Lord, I'm coming home to you.

When fields and code within one mind combine,
A humble worker starts his steep climb.
His meme, a jest that caught the public's eye,
Transforms to glory, built on team and trust.

Within the arena's unforgiving space,
The beasts of challenge circle, set to chase.
Yet like the dolphins in a shark-filled sea,
They innovate, and thus they fight most free.

The king observes with keen and watchful eye,
As strategy o'erpowers brute force's try.
In battles where the weak are quick to die,
This hacker band their unity does tie.

From viral jest to honored, grand display,
The gladiator's path lights up the way.
When hackathon and colosseum blend,
True innovation rises in the end.

Oh, the meme coin lit a wildfire,
Through the kingdom's bustling square!
Like dolphins swift in open waters,
We thrived where none would dare!

Hack away, hack away, code both night and day!
When the beasts come thunderin' through,
We'll forge a path anew!
Hack away, hack away, in the gladiator's play!

From plow and sod to dusty arena,
The worker rallied his band,
The king gazed down from his high perch,
As we clashed upon the sand!

Hack away, hack away, code both night and day!
When the beasts come thunderin' through,
We'll forge a path anew!
Hack away, hack away, in the gladiator's play!

From furrowed fields to lines of code,
Our tale took flight and soared,
With keys we struck like battle steel,
New triumphs to be scored!

The bear of Old Code roared with fury,
Then wolves of Rivals lunged in strife,
Yet with our wits as sharp as daggers,
We carved our way to life!

Together we rise, together we fight,
United in code, we'll claim the night!

Hack away, hack away, code both night and day!
When the beasts come thunderin' through,
We'll forge a path anew!
Hack away, hack away, in the gladiator's play!

The king now crowns our daring deeds,
From sand to hall we're hailed,
Our stream of dreams runs ever strong,
While foes stand awed and paled!

So hoist your pints aloft, me friends,
To the code that sets us free!
From coin to crown, through jest and fight,
The jig's our victory!

In the cold Toronto morning, with our fingers stiff and numb,
A crew of misfits huddled close, their tale yet to become.
We spun a meme coin for a laugh, a spark in winter's chill,
But it blazed like prairie fire through the maples on the hill.

We're the northern code warriors, bravin' storm and strife,
Digital gladiators, codin' warmth to hackathon life.
When the beasts come roarin' at us, we stand firm, unswayed,
Like salmon thrashin' upstream, bold and unafraid.

The market's wild arena loosed its beasts upon our gate,
Like Yukon miners in the mud, we clawed against our fate.
In the hackathon's fierce fire, we carved our rugged stand,
While polar winds went shriekin', new threads slipped through our hands.

The king looms in his tower high,
Eyes sharp through endless night,
Ponderin' if these northern souls
Might claim his royal light.

Sometimes the code that turns the tideâ€¦ rises where the cold winds bite.

From the king's high watch he saw us, through the dark and bitter fray,
Northern lights of genius flared, in shadows and in ray.
They dubbed us mad, like salmon leapin' 'gainst the river's might,
But in these icy waters, somethin' fierce burned bright.

We're the northern code warriors, bravin' storm and strife,
Digital gladiators, codin' warmth to hackathon life.
When the beasts come roarin' at us, we stand firm, unswayed,
Like salmon thrashin' upstream, bold and unafraid.

Now the king has weighed our spirit, from a jest to glory's crest,
From humble fields of farmers to the hackathon's true test.
So gather near and hear this song of code and endless fight,
Where the gladiator's triumph wakes the northern stars at night.

For in the great white North, where dreams can freeze and fade,
Innovation sleeps beneath the snow, then rises, sharp as blade.
